title: In reducing passive play:
body:
Riot actually increase passive play, where a bot laner, top laner or mid laner with any form of advantage plays passive 9 times out of ten once they have an advantage just because farming is 10x as good as fighting despite Riot nerfing farm to the point where the game is less snowbally because in nerfing farm they're free to roam: to ward, further capitalizing their advantage and reducing any chance that they may have to do anything but farm and if you try to go near farm they just walk towards you. I guess by "Aggressive play" they meant "Instantly one sided now stale for the rest of the game" play.

Also in what should be an enemy laner with an advantage playing aggressively, Riot did not forsee that people would simply use this now heavily reduced farm benefit to: Rather than play aggressively; just abuse it and go ward hence making for incredibly stale matchups and gameplay.

Fair trades etc are more aggressive playing than simply zoning and warding and there's not a lot of itemization and countering to be had against "zoning" to make for: interesting play rather than "I will zone you for the rest of forever cause that's more interesting than what was previously actually aggressive play".

There is literally 0 fairness to it. Or fun.
